visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts polar area chart with the title 'Monthly Temperature Variation'. The chart should have a blue background and use the 'Arial' font for all text elements. The x-axis should display the months of the year, and the y-axis should represent temperature values in degrees Celsius. The data series should include the monthly temperature data for a year. The chart should have a legend displaying the series name 'Temperature' in red color. The chart should also have a margin of 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration is designed to render a polar area chart with specific styling and data presentation. The chart is set to have a polar layout with an area type, providing a unique visual representation of the data. The title of the chart is 'Monthly Temperature Variation', styled with the 'Arial' font. The x-axis displays the months of the year, and the y-axis represents temperature values in degrees Celsius, both with labels styled in 'Arial'. The data series includes monthly temperature data for a year, with the series named 'Temperature' and colored red. The chart background is light blue, and the legend displays the series name in red. Additionally, the chart has a margin of 50 pixels on all sides to ensure adequate spacing around the chart elements.
